title: Interest rate cuts needed if Brexit is delayed, Bank of England's Vlieghe warns
text:
Deeper interest rate cuts could be needed if Boris Johnson is forced to delay Brexit, Bank of England policymaker Gertjan Vlieghe warned on Tuesday.

As Government sherpas race to strike an agreement ahead of Thursday’s European Union summit, Mr Vlieghe said a further extension to the UK’s membership would lead to prolonged uncertainty.

This “is likely to keep economic growth below potential and require some monetary stimulus”, he said.

Even if a Brexit deal is struck, Mr Vlieghe said that rate rises would only “eventually” come back onto the agenda if that prompted a recovery in flagging business investment
